Types
RobEntry
typedef struct {
Word 
pc;
ArchRegId 
rd;
} RobEntry deriving(Bits)

Reorder buffer entry.

OboeReorderBuffer
interface
OboeReorderBuffer

Scheduler uses the interface to control ROB.

Method
insert
method Action insert(
BackendInst 
inst
)

Insert an BackendInst into the ROB. Whether this method can be call depends on whether OboeFreeList is able to allocate an entry for the instruction.

Parameter
inst
BackendInst

Instruction to insert into the ROB.

renameRequest
method Tuple2#(
ArchRegId,
Tag
) renameRequest()

ROB issues a rename request from the ROB when the BackendInst coming in is valid and an entry is successfully allocated.

Return

A Tuple2 of ArchRegId and Tag to rename the destination register to the tag.

Subinterface
wbPorts
interface Vector#(
NumWbPorts,
Put
#(
Tag)
) wbPorts

A Vector of Put interface for write back request from execution units. EXU puts the Tag in the put method to indicate the corresponding instruction finishes execution.

Method
commitRequest
method Tuple2#(
ArchRegId,
Tag
) commitRequest()

ROB issues a commit request when the entry pointed by commit_ptr is valid and marked wb_ready. This request is forwarded to the OboeRegAliasTable by the scheduler to update the OboeArchitectureRegMap.

Return

A Tuple2 of ArchRegId and Tag to commit the instruction.

commitAck
method Action commitAck(
Tag 
to_free
)

The scheduler calls commitAck to acknowledge the commit request. Scheduler gives the Tag released by the OboeArchitectureRegMap to update OboeFreeList.

Parameter
to_free
Tag

The entry released when commitment.

mkOboeReorderBuffer
module mkOboeReorderBuffer (
OboeReorderBuffer
)

You know what a reorder buffer is.

Variables
freelist
OboeFreeList freelist <- mkOboeFreeList

OboeFreeList

entries
Vector#(
NumPhysicalRegs,
Reg
#(
Maybe#(RobEntry))
) entries <- replicateM(mkReg(Invalid))

Vector of RobEntry. The main memory storage of the ROB.

wb_ready
Vector#(
NumPhysicalRegs,
Array
#(
Reg#(Bool))
) wb_ready <- replicateM(mkCReg(kNumWbPorts + 1, False))

Vector of registers of Bool. The registers are implemented using mkCReg with <kNumWbPorts> + 1 Reg interfaces. This gives the write-back port with higher index a higher priority to avoid conflict. An extra interface is used by invalidation when commitment. Invalidation has the highest priority.

commit_ptr
Reg#(
Tag
) commit_ptr <- mkReg(fromInteger(kNumArchRegs))

Points to the entry to commit next. OboeFreeList gives the next position when commitment.

tag

Parameter

Tag
) genWbPort(Integer i)

Function to generate a Put interface with index i.
